data.title: Policy change intended to rip you off!
data.text: I have stayed at the Radisson in Utica for many years on Boilermaker weekend.  It is a perfect location to walk to the bus and then back from the after race party. Even tough the hotel is fine - nothing special,  every year we would make our reservations for the following July to stay again - this year we were told we couldn't but the reason was unclear and we should call in January.  I called today, thinking maybe whatever the issue was would be straightened out and I could make my reservation.  Turns out, the General Manager decided to make a change the policy for the Boilermaker weekend. I spoke with him today.  He blocked off some rooms for sponsors (?) and they are all full.I asked when I should have called for one of those rooms and why I couldn't book the day we were there and he had no answer for either of those.    For the rest of the rooms, he has decided to make it a two night minimum.  I'm sure that anyone who has run the race knows, as well as he does, that most runners come in on Saturday and check out after the race Sunday.  This is nothing but a blatant attempt to get an extra $200 or so dollars out of people he knows will only be there one night.  When I asked him to explain the policy - he refused.  I have stayed at this hotel for years an am disgusted at the treatment I received today and this decision to try to rip me off.  Thankfully, I was able to reserve a room down the street. I am very disappointed in this manager's treatment of a long time customer and his absolute refusal to even try to explain.  Sad that he put an end to our long standing tradition...

owner_response.author: Amanda S, General Manager at Radisson Hotel-Utica Centre, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for taking the time to communicate your concerns regarding the Radisson.  I am pleased that, as we discussed in detail yesterday, you have found your past stays as the Radisson so enjoyable.  

The decision made at this hotel in regards to the 2017 race is certainly not an attempt to “rip you off”.  I am pleased that you have found suitable accommodations elsewhere and hope that you will enjoy your annual trip to Utica for the Boilermaker Road Race.

Best Regards, 
Kevin T.
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: It was ok
data.text: The bathroom in my room and also the public bathroom stunk.  I found a receipt on the floor of our room from the previous people that stayed there.   I don't think they vacuum the floors.   It's a nice hotel otherwise and the staff were fantastic.  The bed was very clean and comfortable.

data.title: Beware of Parking Scam
data.text:
The Radisson in Utica is a very nice place to stay - I gave it a 'Very Good' rating.  With that said, I was disappointed when they tried to charge me daily parking fees in the adjacent parking garage on the weekend.  The parking garage was free and open to the public the weekend that we stayed there.  I complained to the manager and he deleted the weekend charges from my bill but I don't think they should expect people to complain before doing so.  When the Radisson requested feedback on our stay, I mentioned this situation and received some nicely worded apology but there was no mention of changing their policy to correct this situation.  Wrong answer.
Also, there was a wedding reception in the hotel that weekend and the music was very loud for a long time.  In all fairness, it ended at a reasonable time but still, if you want to minimize the disturbance, you might want to consider requesting a higher room or a room away from the music.
Overall, I would stay there again.

data.title: Run down and noisy
data.text:
This hotel is in need of serious maintenance. The tiles in the shower are practically falling out of the wall, the furnishings are very dated and the hair dryer didn't work. Also, they have poor soundproofing for their banquet  hall because the wedding reception below my room was obnoxiously loud so I couldn't get to sleep until it was over. 
The only good thing about the place is a pleasant staff. I feel sorry for them that they have to work here.

owner_response.author: Amanda S, Manager at Radisson Hotel-Utica Centre, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for taking the time to reach out to us.  We understand how important a quiet environment is and apologize that the noise from the wedding kept you awake.  I also apologize for the condition of your room, an thank you for bringing the maintenance issues to our attention Your feedback helps us prevent situations such as this in the future.  We hope you will give us another chance if you are in the area again.

Best Regards, 
Amanda S.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Pleasant stay
data.text: My stay at the hotel was pleasant. Only utilized the hotels restaurant was for breakfast but it was more than adequate. Would definitely use the hotel again if in the area. Centrally located to many downtown activities.

owner_response.author: Amanda S, Manager at Radisson Hotel-Utica Centre, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for your feedback and for taking the time to write about your experience.  We are delighted to read that you enjoyed our Encore Lounge, and our central location to the great downtown Utica area . We look forward to your next stay.

Best Regards, 
Amanda S.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Average Hotel - Nice Staff
data.text:
My husband and I were put at the Radisson for a conference I was speaking at for two nights. 

The staff was very kind and thoughtful during our stay. My only issue was the first desk officer said that I didn't need to give my credit card or anything because it was taken care of already.  Then, in the middle of the next day, I get a call from one of the managers asking how the bill was going to be taken care of. 😳 Minor communication issue.

The room was adequate - the window had no screen, but thank goodness did not open too wide. The bed was not that comfortable, but we made due. 

All in all, it was just not memorable or a place I would have chosen to stay at if it had not already been arranged.

owner_response.author: Amanda S, Manager at Radisson Hotel-Utica Centre, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
We apologize for the disappointing service you received from our staff.  Our team works hard to make sure our guests are comfortable and receive our best “Yes I Can!” service. I have reviewed the issues for the billing and check in with our front desk team and I assure you we are working on this issue.  We appreciate you bringing this matter to our attention, and hope for another opportunity to exceed your expectations in the future.

Best Regards, 
Amanda S
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Awesome
data.text: Great staff and great amenities. Greta location, parking is great (usually free for repeat customers). Food is great and service is excellent. I hate the fact that its 200 letters long! Did I mention that I hate that its 200 letters long?

data.title: Halfway point
data.text: The room was very nice and clean. Bathroom was a bit too small, staff very friendly. Wish they had coffee in the lobby. There was a wedding the evening we were there music was a bit loud but didn't bother us.

owner_response.author: Amanda S, Manager at Radisson Hotel-Utica Centre, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for your feedback and for taking the time to write about your experience.  We are delighted to read that you enjoyed the accommodations of the hotel.  We look forward to your next stay.

Best Regards, 
Amanda S.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great staff, tired facility
data.text: We pulled off the interstate looking for a hotel room on our way to NYC. The GPS took us to the Hampton Inn in New Hartford, but sadly, it was sold out. However, the front desk clerk went above and beyond and called a couple of nearby hotels to check availability.  We decided to head towards Utica even though our last experience there wasn't memorable. We called and made a reservation at the Radisson. The booking agent up sold us to the B&B package. The staff were excellent, helpful, efficient and professional.  The hotel itself needs a face lift though and the breakfast was one of those lukewarm, tired, buffet breakfasts that always disappoint. It was served in a huge, dated banquet facility that had no warmth or ambiance. The hotel is clean, it just needs a refresh. Broken sleep number bed, burnt out light bulb and extremely noisy bathroom fan and HVAC. Next time I will call ahead and book a room at the Hampton Inn. So much for spontaneity!

owner_response.author: Amanda S, Manager at Radisson Hotel-Utica Centre, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
We apologize you were not satisfied with the condition of the hotel during your stay. I have shared your comments about the breakfast buffet, and the items that you mentioned in your room such as the bed, and burnt out light bulbs, and we are working diligently to correct those items.  We appreciate you taking the time share your experience.  Your comments are valued, and your suggestions will be used to consider improvements in the future.  

Best Regards, 
Amanda S.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great experience this time
data.text: On our last stay at this hotel, I took issue with paying for parking for a garage that was free to the general public for the weekend due to a malfunction and that was reflected in my review.  This time, the parking garage was definitely open for business so 7 bucks overnight seemed like a good deal.  We were also able to check-in very early and really appreciated the service from Lauren at the front desk.  Service and our room were both very good.  Great location to The Stanley Theater (we were in town for The John Mellencamp show) and restaurants and The Saranac Brewery was walkable as well. Overall a great time and very good hotel.

owner_response.author: Amanda S, Manager at Radisson Hotel-Utica Centre, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for your feedback and for taking the time to write about your experience.  We are delighted to read that you enjoyed our location in relation to the Stanley theater, as well as the service that was provided by Lauren.  We look forward to your next stay.

Best Regards, 
Amanda S.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Downtown Utica
data.text: The Radisson was a nice find in the heart of Utica which provided easy access to restaurants, easy access to freeways and the Adirondack Mountains.  Clean bathrooms, room, comfy bed - can't ask for anything more!

owner_response.author: Amanda S, Manager at Radisson Hotel-Utica Centre, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for your feedback and for taking the time to write about your experience.  We are delighted to read that you enjoyed our fantastic downtown location.  We look forward to your next stay.

Warm Regards, 
Amanda S.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Not a good trip this time
data.text: Many issues to even list, but the biggest item is the sleep number beds - Many of them don't work - Heard other guest complain about the beds being broken. Ours was terrible the bed was broken in the highest position which was hard a as a rock.

owner_response.author: Amanda S, Manager at Radisson Hotel-Utica Centre, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
We are sorry to hear you did not have a good night’s sleep due to the comfort of your bed.  We know a good night’s rest is very important.  Thank you for taking the time to reach out to us and we hope for another opportunity to exceed your expectations. 

Warm Regards, 
Amanda S.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: NY Stay
data.text: Hotel was ok, expected a little more. No hot tub in the pool, breakfast was over priced.  Had to pay for parking which as a hotel guess should of been included in the price. Room was right across from the elevator which was very loud most of the night and early morning.

owner_response.author: Amanda S, Manager at Radisson Hotel-Utica Centre, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for taking the time to reach out to us.  We understand how important a quiet environment is and apologize that the elevator was loud and kept you awake.    Your feedback helps us prevent situations such as this in the future.  We hope you will give us another chance if you are in the area again.

Best Regards, 
Amanda Stanek
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Don't stay until mattresses are replaced
data.text: The staff was very good, and facilities were fine. On-site restaurant and bar a plus. 6am jack-hammering outside the room was not their fault, but unpleasant. The sleepnumber mattress was broken at "rock hard." They are supposedly getting new ones. Don't stay until they do.

data.title: a bit of a disappointment
data.text: didn't deliver what they promised during reservation.  Didn't seem to be interested in making any accommodations when their error brought to their attention Wish we had been informed of need to use city parking and paying for that separately

data.title: The Granddaughter's Wedding
data.text: We received a "welcome" bag of goodies from the bride when we checked in which was a nice surprise.   We found the room to be spacious and clean and had a nice view.  It was very quiet and private.   Even though we could have driven home after the wedding,  we were able to enjoy the wedding and didn't worry about having to drive home late at night.  We enjoyed being with the family and enjoyed the comfort of our room.  We liked the thought of a leisurely morning and looked forward to meeting the family for the brunch.  It all made for a very elegant and special weekend.

data.title: Weekend college football game stay
data.text: Room door was open upon arrival, fitted bed sheet was inside our, cleaning cloth/rag was left on side of tube, sleep number bed control did not work, bed was half sleeping in a hole yams half on a piece of plywood

owner_response.author: Amanda S, Manager at Radisson Hotel-Utica Centre, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for reaching out and writing your review.  We are sorry you were not satisfied with the accommodations of your room. I have shared your comments with our housekeeping department and we are working diligently to rectify these issues and we will ensure all guest rooms are up to Radisson Hotels standards.  

Best Regards, 
Amanda Stanek
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Satisfied
data.text: Have stayed at this hotel several times.  The staff is very well trained and accommodating.  The hotel is well kept, meaning clean and cared for.  The food is decent.  The bar hours are great.  Indoor pool is a good size, and usually quiet.  Parking is pretty convenient.  WiFi was free.  The breakfast buffet was a good value and food was better than expected.  Only negative is that I was too lazy to adjust the Sleep Number bed.

data.title: Great hiotel with great staff
data.text: I have been coming to this hotel for years now.  I like it every time I come.  the staff is always great.  this hotel is located in the middle of downtown Utica.  it has lots of great restaurants and bars around it

data.title: Great for Upstate
data.text: Consistently solid place to stay -food is good; super nice & helpful employees; overall the place is clean & pleasant.  Recommend it for any families or job related trips-head & shoulders above other options in the area.
